text:
The big day has arrived. It's Kerry versus
Dublin. I've got my ticket. Now it is time

For the longest time I've been very indecisive
as towards who to cheer for. But I finally

made a decision. I'm going for the underdog
Kerry. Let's do it!

First up was the minor championship. Guess
what? Kerry won!

It was now time for the main even - Kerry
versus Dublin. The final itself was incredible.

The rapid action and skill of the players
was evident. It's easy to see why Gaelic Football
is the most popular sport in Ireland.

I only wish the weather cooperated as it was
raining for most of the game.

Both teams put in a solid effort but in the
end it was Dublin who won the championship.

I finally found a quiet spot here on the train
bound for Belfast. And I still can't believe
what I experienced at that stadium.

82,000 plus crazy fans all going nuts over
a game. And I have to admit I still don't

know a lot about Gaelic Football but it is
something that has definitely peaked my interest

and I hope I have an opportunity to experience
another game in the future.
